Alliance.description:
The Alliance - Human [Q]
Units:
+5% attack rate

Buildings:
+1 armor
+5% attack rate

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Armor

Magic:
Holy Light (Instantly heals unit for 100 HP)
Blizzard (Deals 100 damage in 200 AoE)
Resurrection (Revives one unit)

Traits: Jacks of all trades but masters of none. Very basic and simple, but versatile and adaptive. Good in every situation, foolproof and idiotfriendly. Easy to play and very boring. Recomended for total Noobs.

Difficulty: Beginer
Alliance.name: Human

Alliance.description:
The Alliance - Dwarf [W]
Units:
+2 armor
-5% attack rate

Buildings:
+10% hit points
Barracks attacks bounce once (35% dmg loss)

Upgrades:
+2Lv Building Armor

Magic:
Ironskin (+4 armor to friendly unit)
Thunder Wave (Deals 90 dmg in a line)
Repair (Instantly heals one unit for 200 HP)

Traits: What they lack in magic and spells, Dwarves make it up in their ingenuity. Weak starting units, but powerful late game mechanical contraptions that are resistant to almost all magic effects.

Difficulty: Advanced
Alliance.name: Dwarf

Alliance.description:
The Alliance - Rogue [E]
Units:
-30% buy cost
+10% attack rate
-2 armor

Buildings:
+100 attack range

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Damage

Magic:
Curse (Gives 1 enemy 25% chance to miss)
Rage (+15% attack rate for 60s)
Shockwave (Deals 125 dmg in a line)

Traits: Cheap and abundant units with significant battle experience. Trained to fight without any honour and show no mercy. But there is a limit what skill can do and the lack of high quality gear has its toll.

Difficulty: Advanced
Alliance.name: Rogue

Alliance.description:
The Alliance - Admiralty of Kul'Tiras [R]
Units:
+2 armor

Buildings:
Improved main building Auras

Upgrades:
-5% cost
+1 start Amulet of Vitality level

Magic:
Tidal Weight (Slows enemy unit by 15%)
Water Bomb (Deals 150 dmg to a unit after 5s)
Tidal Burst (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Kul'Tiras is deeply connected with the sea, so even in ground battles they rely on their knowledge of sea power. Admiralty is akin to a wave, the more power they gain against their foes, the higher they will rise

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Snupi
Alliance.name: Admiralty of Kul'Tiras

Horde.description:
The Horde - Orc [Q]
Units:
+12% damage

Buildings:
+20% damage

Upgrades:
+2Lv Building Armor

Magic:
Bloodlust (+13% attack rate for 60s)
Purge (Slows and removes buffs)
Chain Lightning (Deals 150 damage to 8 units)

Traits: Basic at a first glance, but actually far more tricky to play. Easy to learn, but difficult to master. Very buff and aura dependent race. Augments troop damage output with blind rage and frenzy.

Difficulty: Skilled
Horde.name: Orc

Horde.description:
The Horde - Tauren [W]
Units:
+15% hit points
-10% attack rate

Buildings:
+20% damage
-5% cost

Upgrades:
+3Lv Melee Weapons

Magic:
Spirit Protection (20% dmg reduction in 200 AoE)
Impale (Deals 100 dmg and stuns for 1s)
Ancestral Spirit (Revives one unit)

Traits: Slow and steady wins the race! It is not about dealing damage, its about outliving enemy. Damage output rises slowly and peaks in late game. It depends on brute force and so cannot be denied or dispelled.

Difficulty: Advanced
Horde.name: Tauren

Horde.description:
The Horde - Vulpera [E]
Units:
+5% damage
+5% evasion

Buildings:
+10% attack speed

Upgrades:
+3 Lv Ranged Weapons
Mana Stone's cost and MP given is halved

Magic:
Living Flames Potion (10 dmg/s for 20s to 1 unit)
Weird Stuff (Random buff to an ally)
Fire Wave (Deals 125 dmg in a line)

Traits: Vulpera are a race based on pace, if they can overtake opponents in strength and amount of gold, they will become a very serious opponent. Vulpera love to hoard gold and have plenty to spend it on. The troops, although not very strong, have many tricks to gain an advantage, especially defending the base and crushing the sidelines.

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Ksay
Horde.name: Vulpera

Horde.description:
The Horde - Goblin [R]
Units:
-30% buy cost
+2 hp regeneration (affects mechanical units only)

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+3Lv Ranged Weapons

Magic:
Concussion (Gives enemy 25% chance to miss)
Rage Potion (+15% attack rate for 60s)
Grenade (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Goblins have frail little bodies so they have to relay on their wits and more or less powerful mechanical contraptions. And, of course, explosions. Lots and lots and lots of EXPLOSIONS.

Difficulty: Advanced
Horde.name: Goblin

Horde.description:
The Horde - Troll [A]
Units:
+5% evasion
-5% hit points

Buildings:
+10% attack rate
+10% hit points

Upgrades:
+3Lv Ranged Weapons
-5% costs in Main building

Magic:
Healing Wave (Heals 60 HP for 2 units)
Hex (Reduces target's dmg by -15%, AS by -8%)
Forked Lightning (Deals 200 damage to 5 units)

Traits: Why so serious? Come and have a smoke with us! Fragile in early game, unpredictable in late game. Debilitates and confuses enemy. You won't win all games, but you will have fun in every single one.

Difficulty: Skilled
Horde.name: Troll

Chaos.description:
The Chaos - Satyr [Q]
Units:
+10% spell resist
-10% hit points

Buildings:
+5% attack rate
+2 armor
No Repair and HP regeneration

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Damage
+1 start Legendary Root System level

Magic:
Cursed Power (25% to do 1.5x damage)
Void Rain (Deals 100 damage in 200 AoE)
Shadow Word DEATH (Kills an enemy unit)

Traits: The power of demons has increased their resistance to magic, and the flesh of their enemies will fertilize the cursed forests in which they habit. Their strength is growing every minute, be afraid!

Difficulty: Expert
Chaos.name: Satyr

Chaos.description:
The Chaos - Demon [W]
Units:
+12% damage
+30% buy cost

Buildings:
+2 armor

Upgrades:
+3Lv Building Damage
+10% cost

Magic:
Death Coil (Instantly heals unit for 125 HP)
Rain of Fel (Deals 100 damage in 200 AoE)
Animate Dead (Raises 1 dead unit for 30s)

Traits: Extremely powerful with no real weaknesses. Demons reign in their realm virtually unchalanged. Luckily this is not their realm and keeping dimensional portals open for the supplylines is very expensive.

Difficulty: Beginer
Chaos.name: Demon

Chaos.description:
The Chaos - Fel Orc [E]
Units:
+10% attack rate

Buildings:
+100 attack range

Upgrades:
+10% research speed

Magic:
Cripple (Reduces unit's damage by 25%)
Searing Flame (Reduces unit's armor by 6)
Fel Boulders (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Its more about making your enemies weaker than increasing your own strength. Lots of debilitating effects susceptible to buff dispels. Overfocused on offence and thus lacking in defence.

Difficulty: Skilled
Chaos.name: Fel Orc

Chaos.description:
The Chaos - Undead [R]
Units:
-30% buy cost
-30% buy cooldown
-12% damage
-2 armor

Buildings:
+12.5% mana

Upgrades:
-5% cost

Magic:
Raise Dead (Raises Skeleton Warrior for 20s)
Frost Armor (+4 cold armor to friendly unit)
Frost Nova (Deals 90 damage and slows for 5s)

Traits: Quantity over quality. With the exception of a few dedicated damage sponges, most units are very weak and depend on high numbers rather than strength. Try to spawn them often.

Difficulty: Expert
Chaos.name: Undead

Ancient.description:
The Ancients - Night Elf [Q]
Units:
+1.5 HP/sec regeneration

Buildings:
+0.5 HP/sec regeneration

Upgrades:
+3Lv Building Damage

Magic:
Rejuvenation (Heals 125 HP over 5s)
Entangling Roots (Deals 25 dmg/sec for 4s)
Lesser Starfall (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Dedicated and specialized units, trained to fulfil their role to the max. Balanced and strong race without apparent weaknesses. Its full potential is impresive but it rises slowly and can be hard to reach.

Difficulty: Skilled
Ancient.name: Night Elf

Ancient.description:
The Ancients - Blood Elf [W]
Units:
+5% evasion
-20% spell cooldown
-12% damage
-10% hit points

Buildings:
+12.5% mana

Upgrades:
+1Lv Magic

Magic:
Slow (Slows enemy unit by 15%)
Incinerate (Deals 100 damage to unit)
Polymorph (Disables enemy unit for 4s)
Phoenix Spirit (Deals 150 damage in a line)

Traits: Glass cannons. Extremely weak starting units. Very fragile even in late game. Heavily relies on special upgrades inside towers. Delivers short outbursts of damage. Strong against buff dependent races.

Dificulty: Expert
Ancient.name: Blood Elf

Ancient.description:
The Ancients - Naga [E]
Units:
+2 armor
+15% buy cooldown

Buildings:
+1 armor

Upgrades:
+3Lv Unit Armor

Magic:
Abolish Magic (Dispels buffs from units)
Mana Burn (Burns 100 mana to 1 units)
Water Splash (Deals 100 damage in line)

Traits: Strong race, proficient in ancient arcane arts and magic neutralization. Yet it struggles to establish foothold on surface world. Unit supply is limited and buildings lack solid foundations.

Difficulty: Skilled
Ancient.name: Naga

Ancient.description:
The Ancients - Murloc [R]
Units:
+5% damage
-30% buy cooldown
-3 hp regeneration

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+10% research speed

Magic:
Water Shackles (Slows enemy unit by 15%)
Rage (+15% attack rate for 60s)
Tidal Wave (Deals 100 damage in line)

Traits: Murlocs are a very ancient race of Azeroth which evolved to survive in Azeroth's dangerous aquatic environment.Ancient murlocs lived in the ocean's depths and therefore were never known to the world's early land-dwelling races. Though they are not very strong individually, they compensate it with their huge numbers and powerful sea sorcery

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Crow
Ancient.name: Murloc

Neutral.description:
The Neutral - Pandaren [Q]
Units:
All units except Artillery Units have a 5% chance to deal 1.75x damage
Drunkmaster(Upgrades Abilities)

Buildings:
+10% attack rate

Upgrades:
+1Lv Bamboo Stick
+1Lv Elemental Mix
+1Lv Pandarian Armor

Magic:
Healing Wave (Heals 60 HP for 2 units)
Blessed Lands (Random buff to an ally)
Nature Blast (Deals 150 damage in 200 AoE)

Traits: Strength in beer. All around strong race on all stages of the game. The more pandarens drink, the stronger they get.

Difficulty: Advanced
Neutral.name: Pandaren

Neutral.description:
The Neutral - Arakkoa [W]
Units:
-10% HP
+5% evasion
+2 MP regeneration

Buildings:
-5% HP for Barracks
Barracks have mana shield, instead of Repair

Upgrades:
+1Lv Magic

Magic:
Concussion (Gives enemy 25% chance to miss)
Slow Poison (Deals 12 damage/sec for 15 seconds)
Shadow Strike (Deals 125 damage in 200 AoE)
Final Sacrifice (Kills an enemy non-mechanical unit, gives 0.5 mana to main building)

Traits: Arakkoa are humanoid avians ready to defend their territory no matter what. Few have remained faithful to the light, most have harnessed the darkness and use it on the battlefield. While their initital weakness is a big flaw, it is compensated with strong magic and tough units in the late game

Difficulty: Expert
Created: by Ksay
Neutral.name: Arakkoa

Neutral.description:
The Neutrals - Draconid [E]
Units:
+5% attack rate

Buildings:
+20% damage
-5% cost
-12.5% mana

Upgrades:
-1Lv Magic
+10% research speed

Magic:
Fire Bolt (Stuns the target for 3 seconds)
Reinforcements (Summons Lizardman Warrior for 20 seconds)

Traits: Draconid are mortals empowered by the dragons they serve. This faction is great in the early game but due to the lack of magic, it starts to lose heavily later on. Strong heroes that constantly increase their power are the key to dominating the map.

Difficulty: Advanced
Created: by Ksay
Neutral.name: Draconid

Neutral.description:
The Neutrals - Gnoll [R]
Units:
+10% attack rate
-30% buy cooldown

Buildings:
+20% damage
-5% cost

Upgrades:
+3Lv Melee Weapons

Magic:
Fear (Reduces unit's damage by 25%)
Golem Summon (Summons 1 Mud Golem for 30s)
Agitating Scream (+25% dmg in 600 AoE for 20 sec)

Traits: A very primitive and brutal race, Gnolls thrive in causing as much havoc as possible, while avoiding the big fight. Due to the lack of intelligence among Gnolls, their magic is rather weak, however they compensate for it with their physical power.

Difficulty: Beginer
Created: by Artimenius1307
Neutral.name: Gnoll
